div.div: Results of analysis of sensitivity of climatic velocity to width of bin used to define “matching” climate types.
div.p: Sensitivity is defined in terms of a) median distance to climate match, and b) proportion of the resulting map composed of no-analog climates.
(PDF)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Variation in velocity values (standard deviation, in km/year) between species within a taxa group (birds, mammals, amphibians), and between mean values for the ten GCM projections.
div.p: (PDF)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Distribution of values for climatic (a) and biotic (b-d) velocity, grouped by major climatic zones, based on kernel density estimation of the probability distribution function.
div.p: Climatic zones are as shown in Fig 6.
(PDF)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Distribution of values for forward (top row) and backward (bottom row) climatic and biotic velocity, grouped by latitudinal band.
div.p: Values for biotic velocity were first averaged over all species for each cell, and then the spatial variation in per-cell mean values across each latitudinal band was depicted using a beanplot. Solid black lines show mean values.
(PDF)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Spearman rank correlations between climatic velocity and biotic velocity for three taxa (birds, mammals, and amphibians), for the five major Koppen-Geiger climatic zones of the Americas (equatorial (E), arid (A), temperate (T), cold (C), and polar (P)).
div.p: Upper case and lower case letters represent forward and backward velocity, respectively. Amphibian species were largely absent from polar regions.
(PDF)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Distribution of values within taxa groups of mean forward biotic velocity for individual species.
div.p: Values for biotic velocity were first averaged over each climatic zone on a per-species basis and then between-species variation was depicted using a beanplot. Solid black lines show mean values.
(PDF)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: R scripts for calculating analog-based biotic and climatic velocity.
div.p: (ZIP)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: General circulation models (GCM) used by Lawler et al. (2009) for projections of bioclimatic variables.
